casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Cedric Theodis HOBBS, Jr. 263PA18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 14, 2019

John Keating Wiles, Attorney at Law, Raleigh.

Amy Kunstling Irene, Special Deputy Attorney General, for State of North Carolina. Sterling P. Rozear, Assistant Appellate Defender, for Hobbs, Cedric Theodis (Jr.) Cedric Theodis Hobbs, Jr., for Hobbs, Cedric Theodis (Jr.) Donald H. Beskind, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Equality. David Weiss, Attorney at Law, for Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates. James E. Coleman, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates. Elizabeth Hambourger, Attorney at Law, Durham, for Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates. Robert S. Chang, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Equality. Taki V. Flevaris, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Equality. William R. West, District Attorney, for the State of North Carolina.

*822The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 28th of June 2019 by Defendant to Supplement Record on Appeal:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2019."
